comments:
This is a defect (UnionEList needs to implement EStructuralFeature.Setting).
Please open a Bugzilla report and I'll fix it for this week's build.

Kenn

"Alexander Ny?en" <any@informatik.rwth-aachen.de> wrote in message
news:d9620l$nj7$1@news.eclipse.org...
> Hallo,
>
> I need help with a ClassCastException I receive when trying to use the
> UsageCrossReferencer in the following way ( I want to find a dependency
> pointing at an interface):
>
>
System.out.println("ByFeatureReverseNavigationInstruction.tryToNavigate()
> called with startingPoint " + startingPoint + " and closure " +
> objectClosure);
>             // use a cross referencer to navigate reverse
>             Collection usage =
> EcoreUtil.UsageCrossReferencer.find(startingPoint, objectClosure);
>
> When executing the code above, an exception occurs inside the call to the
> find method and I receive the folloging output/stack trace I cannot
> understand. Any idea, why the class cast occurs? Internal problem between
> UML2 and EMF or misuse by myself? Besides, I use Eclipse 3.1RC3, EMF and
> UML2 from CVS (latest HEAD from today).
>
> Thanks,
> Alexander Ny?en
>
> ByFeatureReverseNavigationInstruction.tryToNavigate() called with

The fix is available in the 1.1RC3 build.
